value.title: How an award-winning AI-powered software is helping students with remote learning
value.excerpt: Amira has received four new awards for effectiveness and innovation with helping students become better readers from afar.

value.title: Computer vision tech helps robots get a grasp on transparent objects
value.excerpt: In order to see and then grasp objects, robots typically utilize depth-sensing cameras like the Microsoft Kinect. And while such cameras may be thwarted by transparent or shiny objects, scientists at Carnegie Mellon University have developed a work-around.

value.title: DotData 2.0 platform delivers AI insights for enterprises
value.excerpt: DotData is announcing version 2.0 of its artificial intelligence and machine learning platform for enterprises so they can adopt AI tools more quickly.

value.title: How Visa harnessed data and AI to prevent $25 billion in fraud
value.excerpt: Visa says it prevents $25 billion in annual fraud thanks to the AI it has developed. The path Visa took to get there offers lessons to other companies.

value.title: CommonSpirit Health leverages data and AI to reimagine health care after the pandemic
value.excerpt: The pandemic is forcing us to reimagine what a "good" health care system looks like. For CommonSpirit Health, that includes AI and personalized care.

value.title: Artie releases tool to measure bias in speech recognition models
value.excerpt: Researchers at Artie released a tool to detect bias in speech recognition systems. In a proof of concept, they find evidence of bias in a Google model.

value.title: Facial Recognition Is Everywhere. Here’s What We Can Do About It.
value.excerpt: You can opt out of facial recognition in some cases, but the history and future of the technology suggest we’ll need bigger solutions to its privacy problems.

value.title: Baidu Tops China's AI Public Cloud Services Market: Report
value.excerpt: Follow @dannyvena Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) boasts the highest market share in China's fast-growing artificial intelligence (AI) public cloud services market, according to a recent report by the International Data Corporation (IDC).

value.title: Microsoft partners with Land O’Lakes to build agriculture tech on Azure
value.excerpt: Microsoft’s latest cloud partnership is with Land O’Lakes, the farming giant which will use Microsoft’s Azure technologies to spur sustainable farming practices and help farmers be more efficient.

value.title: Heathrow Airport Deploys Anti-Virus Robots And Testing To Skip U.K. Quarantine
value.excerpt: London's Heathrow Airport is doing everything in its power to encourage travelers back to the skies. The airport has faced a bleak few months with the number of passengers in June down 95% from the previous year.

value.title: How Chase is using AI to update banking
value.excerpt: Last Chance: Register for Transform, VB's AI event of the year, hosted online July 15-17. As one of the so-called “big four” U.S. banks, Chase needs little in the way of introduction.

value.title: How Intuit is moving from mobile-first to AI-first
value.excerpt: App developers will increasingly have to adopt an "AI-first" mindset by default, according to Intuit chief technology officer Marianna Tessel.

value.title: MIT researchers find ‘systematic’ shortcomings in ImageNet data set
value.excerpt: MIT researchers say the influential ImageNet data set has "systematic annotation issues" when used as a benchmark for evaluating object recognition models.

value.title: Machine Learning In The Enterprise: Where Will The Next Trillion Dollars Of Value Accrue?

value.excerpt: Graphcore, a U.K.-based AI computing startup, has unveiled its new Colossus MK2 GC200 intelligence processing unit (IPU) featuring 59.4 billion transistors, making it currently the most complex chip in the world.

value.title: UNESCO launches global consultation for draft ‘ethics of AI’ guidelines
value.excerpt: To help build a draft resolution on how AI can be developed and deployed, UNESCO is seeking global policymakers and AI experts.

value.excerpt: Winners will be announced on Friday, July 17 beginning at 3:55 pm. Awards will be made in 5 categories from Responsibility & Ethics of AI to AI Mentorship.

value.title: National University of Singapore used Intel neuromorphic chip to develop touch-sensing robotic ‘skin’
value.excerpt: Researchers at the National University of Singapore used an Intel-designed neuromorphic chip to create touch-sensing robotic "skin."

value.title: An Ethics Guide for Tech Gets Rewritten With Workers in Mind
value.excerpt: The Ethical Explorer Pack is designed to help Silicon Valley's rank and file—not just CEOs—steer products away from harmful directions.

value.title: The Pentagon’s $1 Million Question: Can AI Predict An Enemy’s Emotions?
value.excerpt: The science of using AI to detect and predict emotions is shaky but the U.S. military and a handful of well-funded startups are hoping to prove the doubters wrong, whatever the risks.
